column20: Our program is designed to increase your confidence and independence while developing and maturing your procedural skills. There are no areas of weakness in our clinical training with supervision provided by a diverse group of attendings which will help prepare you for the next phase of your career. Maintaining a balance between resident personal and professional aspirations is one of our priorities because your quality of life should not be negatively impacted by the demands of residency.

column20: Rush residents develop outstanding surgical and diagnostic skills under the personalized attention and guidance of faculty dedicated to their success. Our program offers diverse and challenging learning opportunities in all areas of Otolaryngology. All sub-specialties are represented in our program's core faculty. Residents have the opportunity to join a research track, PSQI track, or global health track to supplement their clinical training. Rush graduates are confident, skilled surgeons.

column20: Our program provides the resident with exposure to all aspects encompassed in Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery. Our faculty members are active in all subspecialties of otolaryngology including facial plastic & reconstructive surgery, otology/neurotology,pediatrics,head & neck, sinonasal/allergy,laryngology & voice. Our depth of subspecialty experience allows us to offer three fellowships, in facial plastic & reconstructive surgery, pediatric otolaryngology,and otology/neurotology.

column20: Our program features a unique mentorship/apprenticeship model of training. The one to one experience with an attending accelerates surgical skill training and facilitates longitudinal care of patients. We have opportunities for learning through podcasts, a surgical video atlas, interactive didactics with anatomy lab dissections, and journal clubs. Additionally, our residents are very active in clinical, quality, and bench research and often present at multiple national meetings a year.

column20: The otolaryngology training program at Cleveland Clinic provides comprehensive training in all aspects of ENT. We have engaged staff and residents who promote an excellent environment for learning. We have a wide variety of specialty trained staff to work with the residents in the clinic and OR. Our graduates can practice general otolaryngology at a high level or be competitive for the fellowship of their choice. Cleveland is an easy place to live with a high quality of life.

column20: Located in beautiful Portland, Oregon this residency program offers a mentorship based model of education in all aspects of otolaryngology-head & neck surgery. Our resident cohort is a close-knit and supportive group that is afforded much autonomy in making decisions that impact them. Funding is provided to attend national conferences, and courses. The program happily leverages its extensive network of connections to facilitate residents achieving their varied career interests/goals.

column20: Our program provides training across the scope of our specialty. Our graduates have a tradition of obtaining top notch fellowships, and pursuing both academic and private practice careers. Residents work primarily at a single academic campus with a freestanding adult and children's hospital. Call during the PGY2-5 years is from home. Beyond the excellent clinical training, we provide great research opportunities, and have a new research year for those interested in a 6-year research track.

Our program offers flexibility for residents to prepare a career in either an academic or a community based practice. column20: Our program is distinct in having a commitment to both clinical and anatomic pathology and the flexibility to customize training plans for a variety of careers. All trainees continually make successful academic progress toward independent practice. Research is emphasized and there is funding and dedicated time available for residents to participate in projects. Residents will spend time at each of 4 sites (an academic hospital, a community hospital, a private hospital, and the VA).

column20: Our program offers world class training in AP/CP, AP/NP and physician scientist pathways.  We capitalize on unparalleled learning opportunities in essentially every aspect of anatomic and clinical pathology. The program provides flexibility to meet the needs of individual residents and is proud to participate in creation of future leaders in pathology and laboratory medicine.  While our climate is frosty in the winter, our hearts are warm year-round.

column20: Our heterogeneous surgical pathology signout system has subspecialization for hematopathology, neuropathology, GI pathology, eye pathology, and dermatopathology, the rest is general signout. The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner of Boone & Callaway Counties is in our department and provides over 500 autopsy cases/year in addition to our hospital autopsies. We have a nearly 100% Board pass rate for first-time takers and an excellent record of graduates getting into fellowships.

column20: Creighton's pathology residency is based at a large, academic medical center in Omaha, Nebraska. The department handles over 1 million CP and 35,000 AP accessions annually with a broad depth of specimens. Residents are trained in one-on-one situations directly with faculty pathologists. Residents receive an annual book fund allowance and are issued an iPad which is theirs to keep. An additional travel allowance is available for poster presentations at local/regional/national conferences.

column20: The department of pathology at Dartmouth-Hitchcock offers combined anatomic and clinical pathology training. A structured four-year core curriculum encourages increasing responsibility as residents gain experience and competence. There is ample opportunity for resident research in all areas of the department. In addition to our core pathology program, the department offers accredited fellowships in cytopathology, dermatopathology, hematopathology, and blood banking/transfusion medicine.

column20: The department of pathology at the Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center is the largest quaternary care center in central Ohio offering care in all subspecialties. The program is fully accredited in anatomic and clinical pathology. In the past, the department processed: 80,000 surgical specimens, 30,000 cytology specimens, 230 autopsies, over a million chemistry specimens. There are over 85 faculty members in multiple subspecialties involved in various aspects of resident education.

column20: The department of pathology at the University of TN Medical Center Knoxville has a threefold mission: service, education, and research. The residency and new fellowship offers case volumes per year over 30,000 surgical pathology specimens, 50,000 cytology specimens, and ample clinical pathology cases. The Cancer Institute offers a spectrum of complex oncologic pathology cases. Residents obtain their choice fellowship(s) in a variety of subspecialties with most positions in private practice.

Trainees rotate at a variety of clinical settings, ranging from an academic medical center, to private practice, and a national commercial reference laboratory.  Throughout the training program, an apprenticeship model of learning is used, with graduated responsibility in the handling of a variety of cases.

column20: Our program has a proud history of producing outstanding geneticists who have gone on to play important roles in the field of genetics. We have a diverse patient population which allows us to offer excellent genetics educational opportunities for trainees. The curriculum is combined with laboratory genetics fellowship and genetics counseling master programs, providing a unique learning environment. Applicants will be Board-eligible in pediatrics and medical genetics upon completion.

column20: Our program provides comprehensive training in pediatric medicine and psychiatry throughout the lifespan. Mental health, physical health and psychosocial support are vital in the growth and development of children and their families in today's world. We graduate physicians who take an integrated approach to healthcare. Year 1 emphasizes pediatrics and year 5 focuses on child and adolescent psychiatry. Years 2-4 offer integrated training in both pediatrics and psychiatry.
